page.title: 06Linlithgow Loch and Peel
page.content: The{Loch}and the{Peel}together make Linlithgow one of the most scenic places in West Lothian.It is also a vast recreation area for the people of Linlithgow. {Linlithgow Loch}was formed by an iceberg diverting the river Avon to fill the Loch.It now provides facilities for fishing,canoeing, sailing,birdwatching and jogging. "Peel" means pale or palisade and the grounds within.{The Peel}has many slopes on it because earlier there was a motte and bailey castle before the present palace was built. People come to the loch and Peel to watch birds mainly the{grebes}which the loch is famous for,to walk round the loch and play on the swings.We interviewed visitors to the Peel and one man said it was "the best place on God's Earth".
